title: Journal Articles
text:

library(quarto)
library(stringr)
library(reactable)
library(htmltools)
library(bibtex)

`%||%` <- function(a, b) if (!is.null(a) && length(a) > 0) a else b

cat("Working directory:", getwd(), "\n")

Working directory: C:/Users/CRunyon/OneDrive - nbme.org/Documents/MedEdAI 

cat("Bib file exists?", file.exists("references.bib"), "\n")

Bib file exists? TRUE 

bib <- bibtex::read.bib("references.bib")

cat("Number of entries parsed:", length(bib), "\n")

Number of entries parsed: 1 

print(bib)

Hswen Y, Nguyen TT (2024). "Generative artificial intelligence should
not compromise traditional medical education." _Academic Medicine_,
*99*(6), 589-590. doi:10.1097/ACM.0000000000005674
<https://doi.org/10.1097/ACM.0000000000005674>,
<https://journals.lww.com/academicmedicine/fulltext/2024/06000/generative_artificial_intelligence_should_not.3.aspx>.

title: Abizzy
text: This site was started and is currently maintained by the AI in Med Ed special interest group that is a part of the Directors of Clinical Skills Education as a way to more easily dissiminate information relevant to the use of artificial intelligence in medical education.

title: AI in Medical Education Resources Page
text:
Welcome!
Learning more about the use of AI in Medical Education. In addition to keeping a (relatively) up-to-date list of AI in Medical Education articles, we will post trainings, workshops, conferences, and other events that may be of interest.
